image.altText: Three men lie on hospital beds, side-by-side inside a room

items.synopsis: Thousands of patients will be put at risk as reserves of fuel across Gaza hospitals are expected to last 24 more hours, the United Nations humanitarian office (OCHA) said.

title.children: Gaza hospitals expected to have 24 hours of fuel left, while Israel plans to evacuate residents near Lebanon border

image.altText: Two smiling men wearing black tops with the Aboriginal flag on it. An Aboriginal flag can also be seen in the background

items.synopsis: The landslide No result in Saturday's referendum comes a matter of months after South Australia became the first state in the country to legislate a state-based Voice to Parliament. So what now for the SA Voice?

title.children: What will happen to SA's First Nations Voice to Parliament?

image.altText: Francois Ghassibe walking handcuffed, with a face mask on

items.synopsis: A man who killed a 70-year-old during a road rage incident in Adelaide's CBD will spend at least four and a half years behind bars.

title.children: Taxi passenger sentenced over road rage death of 70yo in Adelaide CBD

image.altText: Supermarket fire

items.synopsis: Two 14-year-old boys will be charged with arson following a large fire that destroyed a supermarket in the Adelaide Hills on Sunday afternoon.

title.children: Two teenage boys arrested over supermarket fire that caused $25m damage

image.altText: A Brahman poking its head up out of a truck in front of a live export ship

items.synopsis: Live export prices are sliding and some producers are taking the risk of sending stock back into the paddock.

title.children: A 350kg steer to Indonesia is now worth $1,000 less than last year

image.altText: An indigenous elder speaking at a Voice event.

items.synopsis: The leaders of both the ACT government and opposition say they remain committed to closing the gap despite the Voice to Parliament referendum defeat, as many First Nations Australians grieve the outcome.

title.children: Ngunnawal Elder says 'there's still hope' for reconciliation as ACT political leaders refocus on closing the gap locally

image.altText: A large group of protesters posing with their signs, outside on a sunny day.

title.children: 'Water is our life': Federal bill introduced to close fracking loophole

image.altText: Donald Tusk speaking into a microphone surrounded by a crowd clapping.

title.children: Poland's opposition has declared a win at the polls — so what does this mean for its alliance with Ukraine?

title.children: 'The Australian community couldn't comprehend what it was': Why the Voice failed

image.altText: An aerial shot of the Gorgon gas project on the coast of Western Australia.

image.altText: Pat Cummins wearing sunglasses in a huddle

image.altText: Toddler in a hospital bed wearing casts on hands and legs after surgery.

image.altText: A man, whose faces is obsucred, walks around a concrete area surrounded by high metal fenced walls.

image.altText: A young person expressing emotion.

title.children: What went wrong for the Yes campaign in South Australia?

image.altText: A bald man sits alone at a long table with a microphone. He is wearing a black suit, white collared shirt and purple tie.

title.children: The former boss of PwC united all sides of politics in an hour by embodying Alan Bond's infamous phrase

title.children: Man in custody after body found with stab wounds in beach carpark on NSW Central Coast
